title: Which are the best programming courses online for kids? - Quora

response.answer_text: Whether as a part of the existing classroom curriculum or as an extracurricular assignment during school closures due to the coronavirus pandemic, parents are increasingly turning to online coding programs for their kids. Coding is the thing that makes our smart cars work, and our smart homes, and everything that makes what people love, and don't think about what makes them work. Among so many available options, choosing the right coding course for your kids is challenging. There are multiple factors to consider before choosing a platform. An updated curriculum, expert teachers, hands-on-practice, and enjoyable learning are the necessary parameters that make a course distinguished and apt for your kids. Here are some of the best online programming courses for your kid:- Scratch:- Scratch is a programming language and an online community where children can program and share interactive media such as stories, games, and animation with people from all over the world. As children create with Scratch, they learn to think creatively, work collaboratively, and reason systematically.Khan Academy:- On Khan Academy, they offer multi-hour, self-paced courses in JavaScript, HTML/CSS, and SQL. For Hour of Code, they have curated one-hour introductions to each of those topics. ... Kids use JavaScript to program drawings and finish with a fun project to draw either a snowman, animal, or self-portrait.Codecademy:- Apart from providing students with valuable text-based courses on web development and programming in different coding languages, Codecademy also offers hands-on experience through interactive projects and quizzes so that kids learn how to apply their newly-acquired knowledge. This website offers separate courses on a number of topics. For example, you can start with learning the basics of web development in HTML & CSS, and then, once your skills progress, work your way up to JavaScript, SQL, and other more complex coding languages.WhiteHat Jr.:- For kids ranging from 5-14, it is quite obvious to choose Whitehat jr. since it is the biggest organization and the most dynamically growing Edtech start-up of today. White hat jr. Is designed to shift people's perspective and approaches to make them as the creators of technology rather than consumers of technology. White hat jr. has divided its curriculum into categories namelyBeginner. - for kids aging 5-6 years Intermediate. - for kids aging 7-8 years Advance. – for kids who are in 4th – 6th grade Professional - for kids who are in 7th - 9th Grade Each group is addressed separately and have separate design directors and ideation teams. They work to make your experience exclusive and fun wherein you work on your personal as well as professional skills. Your concentration power improves and you think creatively. A free online demo class will be provided to you so that you can decide and clear all your doubts about the platform. They make sure you have no doubts left in mind. I would suggest you go and try it today. Seldom have I seen people not enrolling in the courses after knowing about the wonders that it can bring along. Happy coding, Stay Safe, Stay indoors.
